intro: Cheiranthus olympicus, commonly known as the Olympic poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Greece. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
